Research Track 1 - Assignment 2 documentation!

This is the documentation of the ros_robot_sim_pkg ROS package. This package contains all files regarding Assignment 2 of the Research Track 1 course.

Node (a)

platform:

Unix

synopsis:

Action-Client ROS Node for robot simulator

Module author: Ami Sofia Quijano Shimizu

This node implements an action-client, allowing the user to input in the terminal a target (x, y) or to cancel it. It uses the feedback of the action-server to know when the target has been reached. The node also publishes the robot position and velocity as a custom message (x, y, vel_x, vel_z), by relying on the values published on the topic /odom.

Subscribes to: /odom : Topic which receives odometry information

Publishes to: /PosVel : Position and velocity (x, y, vel_x, vel_z) as a custom message

Action Client of this Action Server: /researching_goal :

Description:

Action callback function that displays the feedback from the action-server

Parameters:

  • self – Instance of the class ActionClient

get_user_input()[source]
Description:

Function that asks the user to input a goal coordinate or to cancel the current goal.

Parameters:

self – Instance of the class ActionClient

odom_callback(msg)[source]
Description:

Subscriber callback function that saves the x and y position and the x and z velocity from the /odom topic in a custom message and publishes it

Parameters:

  • msg – Message from the /odom topic

  • self – Instance of the class ActionClient

scripts.acNode_a.main()[source]
Description

Initialization of action-client node and calling of function get_user_input() to ask and read the user’s input

Node (b)

platform:

Unix

synopsis:

Service ROS Node for robot simulator

Module author: Ami Sofia Quijano Shimizu

This node implements a service node that, when called, returns the coordinates of the last target sent by the user.

Subscribes to: /reaching_goal/goal : Topic which receives coordinates of the last target sent

Service: get_last_target : Service which replies with the x and y coordinates of the last target sent as well as a boolean which indicates if the request was successful or not.

class scripts.srvNode_b.GetLastTargetService[source]

handle_get_last_target(req)[source]
Description:

Service callback function to handle requests for the last target coordinates

Parameters:

  • self – Instance of the class class GetLastTargetService

  • req – Request message sent to the server

target_callback(msg)[source]
Description:

Subscriber callback function to update the last_target variable when a new target is received in the /reaching_goal/goal topic

Parameters:

  • self – Instance of the class class GetLastTargetService

  • msg – Message received in the /reaching_goal/goal topic

Node (c)

platform:

Unix

synopsis:

Service ROS Node for robot simulator

Module author: Ami Sofia Quijano Shimizu

This node implements 1) A service that subscribes to the robot’s position and velocity (using the custom message) and 2) Implements a server to retrieve the distance of the robot from the target and the robot’s average speed. The size of the averaging window is set as a parameter in the launch file.

Subscribes to: /PosVel : Topic which /reaching_goal/goal:

Service: get_dist_speed : Service which
